lead_paragraph: Things changed for Alba Somoza after her sister Anastasia, then 9, told President Clinton that Alba wasn’t getting a fair education.

headline.print_headline: For Twin Sisters, a Path to Progress That Began by Bending a President’s Ear
headline.main: For Twin Sisters, a Road to Progress That Began by Bending a President’s Ear

snippet: Things changed for Alba Somoza after her sister Anastasia, then 9, told President Clinton that Alba wasn’t getting a fair education....
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column highlights mission of twin sisters Alba an Anastasia Somoza, who were born prematurely in New York City with cerebral palsy and spastic quadriplegia and now have become advocates for those with disabilities; Anastasia, who is verbal, spoke at Democratic National Convention, while Alba, who needs computer assistance to speak, gives regular college lectures.
